Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: Fwd: [Fwd: [ABUSE] URGENT: Illegal website hosted]
Date: Mon, 4 Apr 2005 23:12:14 -0400
From: Christian Clay Campbell <christian@hdpublishing.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com
CC: Laura Huff <laura@hdpublishing.com>, copyright@theplanet.com

Dear Sir or Madam:

        I am writing for the second time to demand the immediate removal of
the web site currently hosted at http://www.hothostweb.com (67.19.247.204).
The web site hosted at this address is copyrighted material, being parts of
our corporate web site hosted at http://www.affiliatesuccess.net.

        My company owns the exclusive rights -- copyrights, trade and
service marks -- to the names Harris Digital Publishing, Inc., Net
Detective, Turbo-Surfer, Genealogy Detective, CleanCredit, System
Supervisor, and System Detective.  We have in no way authorized the use of
the these names or marks in ANY manner by this individual.  Obviously the
stolen materials are being used to represent some individual or other entity
as HDP, Inc. and this will not be tolerated.

        On behalf of Harris Digital Publishing, Inc., I demand the IMMEDIATE
removal of this web site from your server(s) and/or network.  This is my
second request and legal action will follow if steps are not taken on the
part of your company in a timely fashion.  This web site has already been
publicized in online forums and is financially damaging to our lucrative and
long-standing software affiliate program.  I have previously e-mailed and
spoken with your technical support office.  In my opinion, you have had
ample time in which to deal with this issue and your continued negligence in
this matter is directly contributing to serious damage to my company.

        Please attend to this matter and respond to this e-mail promptly!


Christian
- --
Christian Clay Campbell
Director of Information Technology
Harris Digital Publishing, Inc.

"A question settled by violence, or in disregard of law, must remain
unsettled forever."  -- Jefferson Davis
